line: Are you a semicolon? Because every time I see you, my heart ends with you.
Are you a commit? Because I want to push you to my heart ❤️.
You must be HTML, because you structure my world.
Are you my VSCode? Because I feel productive around you.
You auto-complete me like IntelliSense.
Are we in a recursive function? Because I keep falling for you again and again.
You must be async… because you complete me eventually.
Are you localhost? Because I feel at home with you.
You’re like a 200 OK — everything's fine when you’re here.
Our love doesn’t need testing… it's already bug-free!
Are you CSS? Because you make everything look beautiful.
You must be an API response — because I’ve been waiting for you.
You're like a framework — you give structure to my messy life.
You must be a constructor, because you build my happiness.
Are you a POST request? Because I want to send my ❤️ to you.
You’re the npm to my project — can’t run without you.
You’re like a dark theme — easy on my eyes and hard to live without.
Are you a try-catch block? Because you caught me when I was falling.
You're like a clean PR — no conflicts, just pure compatibility.
You must be an AI model — because you're learning everything I love.
Are you a database? Because I can't stop querying about you.
You're the closing tag to my lonely heart.
Are you a Boolean? Because you’re either the one or the only one.
You’re the default value in my life — I never want to reset you.
Is your name GitHub? Because I want to fork you and keep a copy forever.
You’re my favorite library — always reusable and never deprecated.
Are you an exception? Because I can’t handle you!
Our love is like infinite loop — it just keeps going!
You're like my terminal — black, beautiful, and full of power.
You're the syntax to my program — without you, I break.
